reviewText:
Thought I would wait until I hit the 100 hour mark, but had an amazing experience recently which shows how far I've come and how deep this game really is:

I'm playing as Wrexham FC, a National League mid table team in the UK, and I recently had a fixture against Accrington Stanley. Accrington had expensive and better players, and I knew I would have to spend a full 90 minutes micro-managing the match to get the best out of my team against the odds, because my assistant manager wasn't qualified enough to make the right calls by himself.

And I did it. By using a super defensive tactic, capitalising on the referee's lenient attitude, and hitting the opposition on the counter, I nullified any advantages the better team had, and we won the game 2-0.

Football Manager Touch is one hell of an amazing game. Despite being skinnier than the main version, it's still incredibly deep and very true to life. You are sincerely asked to exercise your knowledge of football with proper managerial skills, and ride the waves of success and defeat. You really do cheer when you win a career-defining game, and you really do throw something across the room when you lose them.

I think it's more or less the best version of Football Manager too, because the game goes at a fast enough pace to feel like you're doing something, and you're not constantly babysitting your players. There are one or two areas where I may feel I would like more control (I would love to manually set up senior-youth tutoring, for example), but it's a compromise I'm generally happy with.

I've only encountered one crash-to-desktop so far in my 90 hours of play time. It's a really stable game at the moment.

Essentially, if you like football, if you fancy yourself a manager; if you enjoy building teams and you don't mind getting addicted to a new game, buy this one. Highly recommended!
